item.title: Report E-2025060124
item.description:
Report E-2025060124

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-11
  • City: BYRAM
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG SPECIALTY PRODUCTS GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver overfilled the customer's storage tank resulting in approximately 500 gallons of diesel fuel being released. A small amount of the diesel fuel was able to impact a nearby storm drain. E3 Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2025050562
item.description:
Report E-2025050562

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 21:18 PM ET, LJS contacted the call center to report a spill that was found inside of a trailer in Richland, MS. The spill consists of approximately 1 pint of 0147HE25 cement, which released from a 1) 5-gallon metal bucket due to insufficient dunnage around the container, which left it dented and slightly leaking onto the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will scoop up the spill and place the waste into a 10-gallon metal drum. Waste ID 235919-1 was generated.
